column4: Hi everyone, I'm in rural Costa Rica helping with a new internet cafe -- got a few questions on edgy
Why would the bootable CD drop me down to BusyBox?  It doesn't make it to the graphical part
maybe it doesn't like your disk-controller. have you tried to boot without 'quiet splash' to see at which point it fails?
so it loads the main menu and i go to the "more options" side?
ok cool doing it now.  This is awesome, these kids in Costa Rica are gonna learn ubuntu
press F6 and delete teh quiet splash options... you need to read what gets on screen
ok it looks like a a ton of I/O errors on fd0 -- no clue why the floppy drive matters so much.  I'm going to disconnect/disable it
after a bunch of I/O errors on floppy, it bombs to busybox
do a CD selftest..
ok thanks.  will report back (i'm sure internet will get disconnected once or twice)
mucho appreciado!
what kind of hardware do you have there?
its a celeron 500 with 256mb ram
kinda sad, they had a bunch of windows boxes working, then the crappy power company had a surge when a transformer blew up
i'm with one of my best buddies, he's the peace corps volunteer setting this up
and you are trying to install which ubuntu-version?
edgy.  should i step it down to 6.06?
edgy is ... errmmm, i'm glad it's obsolete now... Yeah, i'd recommend 6.06 LTS for your case
yeah i'm getting lots of "ATA2:  port failed to respond" errors.  hasn't yet dropped to busybox yet since killing the floppy drive
in edgy there are a lot of experiments, like upstart and libata... take Dapper... less trouble
i see.  well i think the hard drive controller could be the issue.  i'll hack away with some of these other drives.  I'm here to help see what got blown up and what is good
see !install and click your way through to the boot-options listing
thanks!  that's what i need
